intro: Isnardia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or violet, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine gardens. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to both ornamental and ecological landscapes.
